Comments_List: The experience of working with a real-world client to address tangible problems.
I gained improved consulting, group coordination, and legal research skills from my participation in this course.

I developed detailed knowledge of the movement in the United States that is constituted of subnational and non-state actors which have banded together to push back on the Trump Administration's intent to pull the US out of the Paris Agreement on climate change. Most of the world and the country agree that this decision by the Administration is of great peril and folly. The skills I honed and developed were primarily in data analysis and writing, and I gained insights pertaining to the above subject matter.
The knowledge, skills and insights gained in this class aligned well with my expectations.
I did not find the workshop sessions very helpful, but otherwise find the class to be a great opportunity. Josh Galperin is a very committed teacher and I have learned a lot from working with him!

The strength is in the Professor Josh Galperin, as well as Dave Hawkins and the other instructors, and the format of the class. The clinic class leads to a format whereby students get to craft their own experience largely through working with a group and client. This is both a cause of strength and weakness at times. I would've liked to have spent more time in class learning from the many guest speakers, but that was not a requirement for the Advanced version of the class, and for that I am a bit less enriched than I would've liked to have been.
This course is a great way to work on a concrete problem and experience working with a client.

You should definitely find the right clinic class for you, and EPC is a great one, but perhaps not the right fit for every student. This format is very valuable and gives students a very useful opportunity to get professional experience.
